main.name: Will Powell
main.occupation: Soon to be mechanical and electrical engineer.
main.bio: I am currently studying Mechanical and Electrical Engineering at the University of Bath. This website showcases my engineering and programming projects - like this one.

education.degree: Bachelors in Integrated Mechanical and Electrical Engineering

education.description: Higher Level: Maths, Physics and Biology. Standard Level: Russian, Psychology, Literature and Performance

work.title: Software Engineer Intern
work.description: AB Dynamics is an automotive testing company, with a vast range of products from steering robots to driving simulators. I joined as a software engineer, where I immediately identified the vast potential for using vestibular stimulation on the static driving simulator that could emulate dynamic motion. After the approval for a feasibility study, I integrated the simulator's environment with BrainPatch's stimulators with the driving simulators to create the sensation of roll and yaw. I am currently developing this system and hope to conduct a formal experiment shortly.

work.title: Product Development Intern
work.description: BrainPatch is a cutting edge neurotech start-up who aim to create an appstore for the brain. Working alongside the CTO, I assembled and tested a prototype circuit that will be used in their upcoming headsets to stimulate the vestibular system. I then went on to design an analogue backend sensor for EEG/ECG recording. This involved writing to an ADC over SPI, programming the microcontroller in C++, using Python to control the sensor over a remote TCP connection, and designing the electronics and PCB. The first prototype EEG/ECG sensor is soon to be tested and I will continue to work on its development.

projects.title: PhoneCave
projects.category: My first start-up. Check out its website.

projects.title: Chess AI
projects.category: Building a Chess Engine with AI in Python. Optimised using alpha and beta pruning.

projects.title: Space Shuttle Tile
projects.category: Calculating the minimum tile thickness of a heat resistant tile during re-entry to earth's atmosphere. Investigation into numerical approximation methods derived from Partial Differential Equations. Modelling and GUI written in MATLAB.

projects.title: Closed Loop Control of an Automated Vehicle
projects.category: This report shows the design and simulation of a closed loop system in controlling a vehicle's lateral position.
